stance_1: I choose meals based on preference
stance_2: I eat meat when I want to
justification: The interviewee explicitly states that eating meat is a matter of personal choice and preference, directly linking both stances.

stance_1: I choose meals based on preference
stance_2: Meat-eating is not a habit or convenience for me
justification: The interviewee states meat-eating is not out of habit or convenience but is based on what they want to eat, supporting the preference-based meal choice.

stance_1: Lifestyle change can motivate less meat-eating
stance_2: Meat-eating is not a habit or convenience for me
justification: If meat-eating is not habitual or convenient, it is easier to make lifestyle changes, supporting the idea that lifestyle change motivates eating less meat.

stance_1: I eat meat when I want to
stance_2: Meat-eating is not a habit or convenience for me
justification: The interviewee explicitly separates eating meat from habit or convenience, stating they eat meat when they want to, which directly supports both stances.
